alert.note: Alert for Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 12 at 1:18PM MDT until October 13 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOWFALL EXPECTED IN PORTIONS OF THE BLACK HILLS TODAY INTO FRIDAY... .A potent storm system will bring heavy precipitation and strong winds to the region today through Friday. Rain has been ongoing for much off the region since last night, and snow has started in the Black Hills late this morning. Accumulating snow is expected over much of the Black Hills through Friday morning, particularly across higher elevations of the northern and central hills. Some snow will also be possible if rain changes to snow in the Black Hills foothills tonight. If this does occur, accumulations will be light. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...The Northern Black Hills and the Central Black Hills. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.

area.areaDesc: Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills
